articles.headline: Megastores March Up Avenue, and Paris Takes to Barricades
articles.snippet: The Paris city government has promised a plan aimed at stopping the “banalization” of the Champs-Élysées.
articles.abstract: The Paris city government has promised a plan aimed at stopping the “banalization” of the Champs-Élysées.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 30 — There was a time when the Champs-Élysées stood for grand living, high style and serendipity. With the Arc de Triomphe on one end and the Tuileries Gardens on the other, you could discover an underground jazz band at midnight and down oysters and Champagne at dawn.

articles.headline: Icahn Seeks Board Seat at Motorola
articles.snippet: Carl C. Icahn, who has made a career of agitating for change at large companies, wants Motorola to use its $10.5 billion cash pile toward a huge buyback of shares.
articles.abstract: Carl C. Icahn, who has made a career of agitating for change at large companies, wants Motorola to use its $10.5 billion cash pile toward a huge buyback of shares.
articles.lead_paragraph: Motorola, Carl C. Icahn is calling.

articles.headline: Nintendo’s Wii,  Radiating Fun, Is Eclipsing Sony Machine
articles.snippet: There are growing signs that Nintendo’s Wii, which gets couch potatoes off the couch, has taken the lead over Sony’s PlayStation 3.
articles.abstract: There are growing signs that Nintendo’s Wii, which gets couch potatoes off the couch, has taken the lead over Sony’s PlayStation 3.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Jan. 30 — Some of the video game industry’s smartest minds thought that couch potatoes wanted richer graphics and more challenging virtual worlds. It turns out that a lot of potatoes simply wanted to get off the couch.

articles.headline: Deal Struck on Claims of Nazi Era
articles.snippet: Lawyers for victims of the Holocaust are giving up their fight for a larger payout of life insurance claims from an Italian insurance company.
articles.abstract: Lawyers for victims of the Holocaust are giving up their fight for a larger payout of life insurance claims from an Italian insurance company.
articles.lead_paragraph: After nearly 10 years of struggling to have a big Italian insurance company pay claims on life insurance policies sold to victims of the Holocaust, lawyers who say they represent most of the victims are giving up the fight.

articles.headline: Wall Street Finds a Lot to Like About Tobacco
articles.snippet: Despite regulations and legal settlements, investors seem to believe the future of cigarettes is brighter than ever.
articles.abstract: Despite regulations and legal settlements, investors seem to believe the future of cigarettes is brighter than ever.
articles.lead_paragraph: There are plenty of reasons cigarettes would seem to be a terrible business.

articles.headline: Once a Dream Fuel, Palm Oil May Be an Eco-Nightmare
articles.snippet: Rising demand for fuel derived from plants has brought about the clearing of huge tracts of Southeast Asian rainforest for palm plantations.
articles.abstract: Rising demand for fuel derived from plants has brought about the clearing of huge tracts of Southeast Asian rainforest for palm plantations.
articles.lead_paragraph: AMSTERDAM, Jan. 25  Just a few years ago, politicians and environmental groups in the Netherlands were thrilled by the early and rapid adoption of “sustainable energy,” achieved in part by coaxing electrical plants to use biofuel  in particular, palm oil from Southeast Asia.

articles.headline: You Want Innovation? Offer a Prize
articles.snippet: Back in the 1700s, prizes were a fairly common way to reward innovation. But today’s economy doesn’t have nearly enough of them.
articles.abstract: Back in the 1700s, prizes were a fairly common way to reward innovation. But today’s economy doesn’t have nearly enough of them.
articles.lead_paragraph: Besides the fact that both are considered great movies, “The Wizard of Oz” and “Silence of the Lambs” don’t have much in common. One is the story of a girl from Kansas who’s transported to a magical land where animals dance and sing, and the other is about a serial killer who eats his victims. You wouldn’t necessarily expect people to have similar reactions to the two movies.
